alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 30 at 3:00AM CST until November 30 at 3:15AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CST FOR EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 300 AM CST, a confirmed tornado was located 4 miles east of Tibbie, or 8 miles southeast of Chatom, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Washington County. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
